advo.utils package

Submodules

advo.utils.compute_metrics module

advo.utils.compute_metrics.compute_metrics_remove_cards(ytest, prediction_scores, id_cards_test, id_cards_fraud_train)[source]
advo.utils.compute_metrics.compute_pk(trueY, predictions, K)[source]
advo.utils.compute_metrics.evaluate_models(predictions_proba: List[ndarray], discrete_predictions: List[ndarray], users: Series, names: List[str], y_test: ndarray, K_needed: List[int]) → Tuple[List[PrecisionRecallDisplay], DataFrame, Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]][source]

This function takes in a list of probability predictions, a list of discrete predictions, a list of names for each model, the true labels for the test set, and a list of K values for the pk metric. It returns a list of PrecisionRecallDisplay objects, a DataFrame with metrics for each model, and a dictionary with pk scores for each model.

Copy code :param predictions_proba: A list of probability predictions for each model :param discrete_predictions: A list of discrete predictions for each model :param names: A list of strings with names for each model :param y_test: The true labels for the test set :param K_needed: A list of K values for the pk metric

Returns

A tuple with a list of PrecisionRecallDisplay objects, a DataFrame with metrics for each model, and a dictionary with pk scores for each model.

advo.utils.fraud_metrics module

advo.utils.fraud_metrics.amount_saved(y_true, y_pred, amounts, cards=None)[source]
advo.utils.fraud_metrics.apply_threshold(y_score, threshold)[source]
advo.utils.fraud_metrics.average_precision(y_true, y_score, recall_value, sorted=False, reference_ratio=None)[source]

Evaluate the Average Precision up to a given recall value.

Parameters

  • y_true – The true labels

  • y_score – The scores given by the model

  • recall_value – The recall value up to which the average precision must be calculated

:param sorted indicates if the y values are sorted :param reference_ratio: the reference ratio for calibration :return: the Average Precision

advo.utils.fraud_metrics.pk(y_true, y_score, rank, type='tx', sorted=False, cards=None)[source]
advo.utils.fraud_metrics.plot_f_score_curve(y_true, y_score, type='tx', cards=None, title=None, plot_save_path=None, thresholds_save_path=None, precisions_save_path=None, recalls_save_path=None, f_scores_save_path=None)[source]

Plots the F-score curve

Parameters

  • y_true – The true labels

  • y_score – The scores given by the model

  • type – either “tx” or “card”

  • cards – If type is “card”, array of pan_ids

  • title – Title of the plot

  • plot_save_path – Path where the plot will be saved (png format)

  • thresholds_save_path – Path where the array of thresholds will be saved (npy format)

  • f_scores_save_path – Path where the array of f-scores will be saved (npy format)

advo.utils.fraud_metrics.plot_precision_recall_curve(y_true, y_score, type='tx', cards=None, title=None, plot_save_path=None, precisions_save_path=None, recalls_save_path=None, thresholds_save_path=None)[source]

Plots the precision recall curve

Parameters

  • y_true – The true labels

  • y_score – The scores given by the model

  • type – either “tx” or “card”

  • cards – If type is “card”, array of pan_ids

  • title – Title of the plot

  • plot_save_path – Path where the plot will be saved (png format)

  • precisions_save_path – Path where the array of precisions will be saved (npy format)

  • recalls_save_path – Path where the array of recalls will be saved (npy format)

  • thresholds_save_path – Path where the array of thresholds will be saved (npy format)

Computes the precision recall curve

Parameters

  • y_true – The true labels

  • y_score – The scores given by the model

  • type – either “tx” or “card”

  • cards – If type is “card”, array of pan_ids
